intro: Phyllostegia hobdyi, commonly known as the rockbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its hairy, aromatic leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and often have a serrated margin, while its flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming in summer. Phyllostegia hobdyi is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
